lead_paragraph: Approaching addiction as a disease, the Gloucester Police Department became the unusual law enforcement agency offering heroin users an alternative to prison.
snippet: Approaching addiction as a disease, the Gloucester Police Department became the unusual law enforcement agency offering heroin users an alternative to prison.

headline.main: Massachusetts Chief’s Tack in Drug War: Steer Addicts to Rehab, Not Jail
headline.print_headline: Throwing Away the Book, a Police Chief Stresses Rehab Over Jail

abstract: Profile of Gloucester, Mass, Police Chief Leonard Campanello, who has established innovative program in which heroin addicts who turn themselves in to police are guided toward immediate treatment with no fear of criminal charges; 391 addicts have taken part in program since Campanello began offering it in spring of 2015, and police departments across nation have begun offering similar programs, indication of frustration nationwide with heroin addiction epidemic.
